N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.116 - Executive Order No. 116: Directing that the Chief of Staff to the Governor order into active service the organized militia to staff armories in the City of New York in order to provide emergency temporary shelter for homeless individuals during the period of cold weather

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, by virtue of the authority vested in me
as Governor under section
6
of the Military

Law of the State, do hereby direct by Executive Order that the Chief of Staff
to the Governor order into the active service of the State, for such period, to
such extent, and in such manner as he may deem necessary, all or any part of
the organized militia to assist the Human Resources Administration of the City
of New York in providing emergency temporary shelter in nonessential areas of

New York State armories, during this current period of cold weather, for
individuals who are homeless. (1)

Major General Vito J. Castellano, Chief of Staff to the Governor, is hereby
appointed commander of all personnel ordered into the active service of the

State. (2)

Units and members of the
organized militia to be designated by order of the Chief of Staff to the

Governor will immediately assemble at their local armories when ordered, and
will remain assembled pending further orders as to their disposition by the

Chief of Staff to the Governor. (3)

All enlistments, reenlistments or voluntary extension of enlistments which
expire after November 25, 1981, and during the period for which the members are
currently ordered into the active service of the State, are hereby extended for
the duration of such duty in the active service of the State. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: November 25, 1981
